Anti-Gravity Pulse.name: Anti-Gravity Pulse
Anti-Gravity Pulse.descriptionHazard: A harmful pulse of anti-gravity is activated by a sensor that detects motion within 30 feet.
Anti-Gravity Pulse.disable: @Check[computers|dc:18] (trained) to jam the motion detector's signal or @Check[thievery|dc:16] (trained) to deactivate the motion detector

action->Gravity Pulse.name: Gravity Pulse
action->Gravity Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature enters the sensor's detection area

Effect The trap releases a gravity pulse, dealing @Damage[(2d6+3)[force]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save). The area within 30 feet of the sensor then becomes zero gravity for 1 minute.

Caustic Nectar Spray.name: Caustic Nectar Spray
Caustic Nectar Spray.descriptionHazard: An alien flower sprays a stream of caustic nectar.
Caustic Nectar Spray.disable: @Check[nature|dc:13] (trained) to lull the flower into a passive state, or @Check[survival|dc:13] (trained) to mislead the flower's senses; @Check[acrobatics|dc:16] to move by the flower without triggering it (this doesn't disable the trap)
Caustic Nectar Spray.reset: The flower's nectar reserve is refilled after 1 hour.

action->Nectar Spray.name: Nectar Spray
action->Nectar Spray.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 15 feet of the flower

Effect The flower makes a nectar Strike against the triggering creature.

Collapsing Building.name: Collapsing Building
Collapsing Building.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:38] (expert) or Nature (expert) to magically prop up the building, @Check[crafting|dc:34] (master) or Survival (master) to stabilize the building, @Check[religion|dc:38] (expert) to pray for the collapse to cease; four total successes are required to stop the collapse
Collapsing Building.routine: (1 action) The building begins to collapse. All creatures in the building take @Damage[(3d10+18)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save). A creature that critically fails its save is additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

action->Shudder.name: Shudder
action->Shudder.description:
Trigger An effect damages the building, or the ground around the building shifts

Effect The building shudders and creaks, signaling an imminent collapse. The building's interior becomes difficult terrain. The trap rolls initiative.

Cryo Mist.name: Cryo Mist
Cryo Mist.descriptionHazard: Hidden nozzles in the ceiling release hyper-cold air, potentially freezing intruders in place.
Cryo Mist.disable: @Check[computers|dc:27] (master) to increase the air's temperature to safe levels, or @Check[thievery|dc:27] (master) to deactivate the nozzles

action->Freeze!.name: Freeze!
action->Freeze!.description:
Trigger A creature moves below the nozzles

Effect The trap sprays cold air on the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(4d10+26)[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:33] save).

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} or [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, becomes clumsy 2, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 minute. Creatures within 10 feet of the triggering creature take @Damage[(2d12+13)[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save).

Deadly Vidgame.name: Deadly Vidgame
Deadly Vidgame.descriptionHazard: A hyperrealistic vidgame pulls players into a virtual world, transforming them into pixelated avatars and pitting them against deadly challenges.
Deadly Vidgame.disable: @Check[computers|dc:22] (trained) to reprogram the game, or @Check[thievery|dc:22] (trained) to exploit a glitch, or @Check[Vidgame Lore|dc:17] (trained) to beat the game; four total successes are required to disable the trap
Deadly Vidgame.routine: (1 action) The trap presents the game's players with deadly challenges as 1 action. Each creature inside the game takes @Damage[(2d8+5)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). A creature can attempt a Vidgame Lore check in place of their saving throw, if desired.

action->New Game.name: New Game
action->New Game.description:
Trigger A creature begins to play the vidgame

Effect The trap attempts to pull all players into the vidgame. Each player must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and can play the game from the safety of reality.

Success The creature is pulled into the game for 1 round, then immediately escapes the game, returning to reality.

Failure The creature is pulled into the game and can't escape the game until the trap is disabled.

Critical Failure The creature is pulled into the game and can't escape the game until the trap is disabled. Unfortunately, it's playing on hard mode, and it treats the DC of the trap's routine as 2 higher.

action->Auto-Save.name: Auto-Save
action->Auto-Save.description: If the vidgame console is turned off, all creatures inside the vidgame remain inside the vidgame and are temporarily removed from reality. If the vidgame console is turned back on, these creatures continue the game where they left off.

Devastating Collision.name: Devastating Collision
Devastating Collision.descriptionHazard: A phantom hover truck collides with creatures, replaying an accident from the past in gory detail.
Devastating Collision.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:38] (master) to disperse the phantom truck, or @Check[religion|dc:36] (master) to ward yourself from harm
Devastating Collision.stealth: (master) to hear the roar of hover jets

action->Crash.name: Crash
action->Crash.description:
Trigger A creature crosses the street

Effect A phantom hover truck crashes into all creatures crossing the street, dealing @Damage[(6d12+37)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43] save).

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage, is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and is pushed 10 feet back.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is pushed 20 feet back.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is pushed 30 feet back.

Disintegration Chamber.name: Disintegration Chamber
Disintegration Chamber.descriptionHazard: When sensors detect movement in the trapped room, the doors seal shut, and four wall apertures open, releasing disintegrating nanites into the room.
Disintegration Chamber.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:22] (trained) or Thievery (trained) on the control panel to deactivate the trap, or @Check[computers|dc:24] (trained) to reprogram the control panel
Disintegration Chamber.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Disintegration Chamber.routine: (1 action) The trap launches nanites against every creature in the room as 1 action. Because it launches nanites continuously, the trap can also use the Nanite Swarm free action (see below) to launch nanites at each creature during that creature's turn.
Disintegration Chamber.stealth: (expert) or DC 31 (expert) to notice the control panel

action->Nanite Release.name: Nanite Release
action->Nanite Release.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room or ends its turn in the room

Effect The trap makes a nanite Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

action->Nanite Swarm.name: Nanite Swarm
action->Nanite Swarm.description:
Trigger A creature within the room ends its turn

Effect The trap makes a nanite Strike against the triggering creature.

Distracting Holo Ad.name: Distracting Holo Ad
Distracting Holo Ad.descriptionHazard: Colorful, lifelike figures flit in and out of a holographic advertisement in a barrage of pleasant sounds and sensations, enticing passersby to spend their credits. The hologram's source is a nearby projector.
Distracting Holo Ad.disable: @Check[computers|dc:17] (trained) to deactivate the ad, or @Check[crafting|dc:20] (trained) or Thievery (trained) to disable the projector
Distracting Holo Ad.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Distracting Holo Ad.routine: (1 action) The hazard plays a new ad each round, forcing all creatures that can sense it to attempt a new save.
Distracting Holo Ad.stealth: (trained), or DC 20 (expert) to notice the holoprojector, or detect magic

action->Buy! Buy! Buy!.name: Buy! Buy! Buy!
action->Buy! Buy! Buy!.description:
Trigger A creature in the area finishes an action

Effect The trap launches a targeted ad enticing viewers to spend credits on a product or service. All creatures within 30 feet who can see, hear, or sense the ad must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17] save. The trap rolls initiative.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.

Failure The target is dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round and can't take any actions except to access the nearest computer or comm unit and make purchases as directed by the ad.

action->Controlled Plummet.name: Controlled Plummet
action->Controlled Plummet.description: This vehicle is programmed to deploy from another airborne vehicle or spaceship and fall toward the ground at a rate of 500 feet the first round and 1,500 feet each round thereafter, for a world with normal gravity. One round before impact, antigrav rotors, parachutes, and retrorockets slow the descent to 60 feet per round, allowing for a safe landing (even if uncontrolled).

action->Enclosed.name: Enclosed
action->Enclosed.description: The pilot and passengers of a drop pod are completely enclosed and don't have line of sight or line of effect with any creatures or objects outside the vehicle.

action->Space Vehicle.name: Space Vehicle
action->Space Vehicle.description: This vehicle protects its users from the dangers of space, including the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.FLODmOj4yK7eJn0a]{Basic Environmental Protection} and a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.0kD0MZgiK0SYS6e6]{Commercial Filtered Rebreather}.

Electric Fence.name: Electric Fence
Electric Fence.descriptionHazard: A 15-foot-tall electrified fence electrocutes anyone who touches it.
Electric Fence.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:17] (trained) to ground a 10-foot portion of the fence, or @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to cut power to the fence
Electric Fence.routine: (1 action) The trap electrocutes each creature touching the fence directly or with a tool, dealing @Damage[1d10[electricity]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save).

action->Buy! Buy! Buy!.name: Buy! Buy! Buy!
action->Buy! Buy! Buy!.description:
Trigger A creature touches the fence directly or with a tool

Effect The trap deals @Damage[1d10[electricity]] damage to the triggering creature. The trap rolls initiative if it hasn't already.

action->Portable.name: Portable
action->Portable.description: The enercycle can be pulled along the ground on its wheel by a Medium creature. The creature is encumbered.

Exploding Egg Sac.name: Exploding Egg Sac
Exploding Egg Sac.descriptionHazard: An ovular alien egg sac emerges from the ground or other surface; pulsing, veinlike filaments cover all surfaces in a 30-foot radius around the egg sac.
Exploding Egg Sac.disable: @Check[nature|dc:30] (trained) to cause the egg sac to implode, or @Check[survival|dc:23] (expert) to safely destroy the filaments in an adjacent square
Exploding Egg Sac.reset: If the egg sac survives and hasn't hatched, filaments regrow in 1 day.

action->Explode.name: Explode
action->Explode.description:
Trigger A creature touches the egg sac or touches a filament

Effect The trap makes a filament Strike against all creatures within 30 feet of the egg sac, then the egg sac explodes, dealing @Damage[(2d10+9)[acid]] damage to all creatures within 30 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). If the creature within the egg sac is viable, it hatches.

Explosive Overload.name: Explosive Overload
Explosive Overload.descriptionHazard: A generator, engine, or other large immobile device overloads and is moments from catastrophically exploding.
Explosive Overload.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:19] (trained) to safely shut down the device, or @Check[thievery|dc:21] (trained) to quickly vent the device

action->Explode.name: Explode
action->Explode.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the device

Effect The trap makes a loud noise. At the end of the next round, the device explodes, dealing @Damage[(2d6+5)[piercing]] damage to all creatures within 15 feet of the device (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). This explosion destroys the device.

action->Free Action.name: Free Action
action->Free Action.description: A forklift carries its cargo on its front forks and can carry up to 1,000 Bulk.

action->Lift.name: Lift
action->Lift.description: The pilot raises the forklift's forks up to 15 feet in the air, or lowers the forklift's forks down to the ground.

Hacker's Folly.name: Hacker's Folly
Hacker's Folly.descriptionHazard: A ghostly hacker haunts their computer and attempts to drain the spirit of anyone who accessed the computer.
Hacker's Folly.disable: @Check[computers|dc:16] (trained) to partition the haunted code, or @Check[religion|dc:18] (trained) or Occultism (trained) to exorcise the spirit
Hacker's Folly.routine: (1 action) The haunt absorbs the spirits of the living, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[spirit]] damage to all living creatures within 10 feet of the computer (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. This routine doesn't count as a hostile action for the purposes of ending the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition.

action->Hacker's Fixation.name: Hacker's Fixation
action->Hacker's Fixation.description:
Trigger A creature touches the console directly or with a tool

Effect The haunt distracts the user with colorful graphics and interesting data while lowering their mental defenses. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is stupefied 1.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. Additionally, they are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the computer and can't take any actions except to passively view the data on the computer. At the end of each of their turns, they can retry this saving throw to remove the fascinated condition.

Haywire Autopilot.name: Haywire Autopilot
Haywire Autopilot.descriptionHazard: A hovercar's autopilot goes haywire, causing it to run over nearby creatures.
Haywire Autopilot.disable: @Check[computers|dc:26] (expert) to remotely reprogram the autopilot, or @Check[piloting|dc:24] or @Check[thievery|dc:24] (expert) to override the autopilot while aboard the car; three total successes are required to disable the trap; @Check[acrobatics|dc:23] or @Check[athletics|dc:23] to board the car (boarding doesn't disable the trap)
Haywire Autopilot.routine: (3 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each successful disable. The hovercar uses 1 action to drive 30 feet in a straight line, three times, changing direction between actions as desired. Creatures in the area the hovercar passes through take @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures damaged by the car are additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Ram.name: Ram
action->Ram.description:
A creature moves within 30 feet of the hovercar

Effect The hovercar drives 30 feet in a straight line, dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the area it passes through (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures damaged by the car are additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The trap then rolls initiative.

Haywire Robotic Arm.name: Haywire Robotic Arm
Haywire Robotic Arm.descriptionHazard: A robotic manufacturing arm malfunctions, attacking nearby creatures.
Haywire Robotic Arm.disable: @Check[computers|dc:20] (trained) to debug the malfunctioning arm, or @Check[crafting|dc:25] (trained) to cause the arm's joints to seize, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to disable the arm

action->Manufacture.name: Manufacture
action->Manufacture.description:
Trigger A creature moves within reach of the robotic arm

Effect The trap makes an arm Strike against the triggering creature, then Grabs (+17 Athletics). A creature @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the trap takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bludgeoning]] damage until they @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (DC 27) or the trap is deactivated or destroyed.

action->Hover.name: Hover
action->Hover.description: A hoverboard maintains an altitude of 6 inches above other surfaces, such as the ground or water. If driven off a high surface, the hoverboard loses 20 feet of altitude per round, landing without harm to the hoverboard or its pilot.

action->Portable.name: Portable
action->Portable.description: The hoverboard can be carried as an item with 1 Bulk.

Jolting Console.name: Jolting Console
Jolting Console.descriptionHazard: A shock grid built into a computer console or door panel releases a powerful electric charge.
Jolting Console.disable: @Check[computers|dc:16] (trained) to disable the console's programming, or @Check[crafting|dc:17] (trained) to rewire the shock grid, or @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to deactivate the shock grid

action->Jolt.name: Jolt
action->Jolt.description:
Trigger A creature grasps the console directly or with a tool

Effect The trap deals @Damage[5d8[electricity]] damage to the triggering creature and creatures within 5 feet of the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).

Laser Turret.name: Laser Turret
Laser Turret.descriptionHazard: A concealed turret pops up and fires a laser when intruders enter a secure area.
Laser Turret.disable: @Check[computers|dc:18] (trained) to reprogram the turret, or @Check[crafting|dc:17] (trained) to cut power to the turret, or @Check[thievery|dc:16] (trained) to disable the turret
Laser Turret.routine: (3 actions) The trap makes a laser Strike against up to three creatures in range, or multiple Strikes against one creature in range if it has no additional targets.

action->Laser Blast.name: Laser Blast
action->Laser Blast.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the turret

Effect The trap makes a laser Strike against the creature; the trap rolls initiative.

Laser Web.name: Laser Web
Laser Web.descriptionHazard: Six sensors concealed in a 15-foot-long corridor fire lasers when they detect movement.
Laser Web.disable: @Check[computers|dc:15] (trained) or Thievery (trained) to disable each sensor, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:23] (expert) to slip past each sensor

action->Laser Web.name: Laser Web
action->Laser Web.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 5 feet of a sensor

Effect The lasers fire, each one Striking a creature in the hallway. If there are more creatures than lasers, the lasers prioritize the triggering creature or creatures; if there are fewer creatures than lasers, the lasers prioritize Striking the triggering creature or creatures multiple times.

Memory Crystals.name: Memory Crystals
Memory Crystals.descriptionHazard: Glowing yellow crystals refract the blurred imprints of stolen memories within their facets.
Memory Crystals.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:48] (legendary) to erect mental wards, or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to harmlessly feed surface thoughts to the crystals, or @Check[religion|dc:51] (legendary) to pray for protection from the crystals
Memory Crystals.reset: After expanding, the memory crystals can't grow again for 1 day.

action->Leech Memories.name: Leech Memories
action->Leech Memories.description:
Trigger A non-mindless creature comes within 5 feet of the memory crystals

Effect The memory crystals expand into every square adjacent to their space. As they grow, they absorb memories and ambient thought from their surroundings, dealing @Damage[8d10[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save) to creatures within 10 feet after they expand.

action->Memory Field.name: Memory Field
action->Memory Field.description:
Aura 5ft

Memory crystals deal @Damage[8d10[mental]] damage to nearby creatures.

Monument to the Devourer.name: Monument to the Devourer
Monument to the Devourer.descriptionHazard: This shrine has long served as an altar for sacrificial rites and foul magic. When non-believers approach the monument, the souls of all those killed here surge out to reap their lives.
Monument to the Devourer.disable: @Check[deception|dc:33] (master) to pose as a believer and command the monument to still, or @Check[religion|dc:30] (expert) to pray to the gods for protection, or @Check[occultism|dc:30] (expert) to soothe the trapped spirits; two successes are required to disable it

action->Surge of Trapped Souls.name: Surge of Trapped Souls
action->Surge of Trapped Souls.description:
Trigger A living creature moves within 15 feet of the monument

Effect The souls of all those killed by this monument surge outward, dealing @Damage[(4d10+22)[void]] damage to all living creatures within 60 feet of the monument (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save). Creatures killed by this haunt have their soul trapped in the monument until the monument is destroyed.

Mutation Fog.name: Mutation Fog
Mutation Fog.descriptionHazard: A fog of transmutative fumes fills a 30-foot radius area, painfully mutating creatures who enter.
Mutation Fog.disable: @Check[nature|dc:35] (master) to neutralize the fog, or @Check[survival|dc:35] (master) to disperse the fog

action->Harmful Mutation.name: Harmful Mutation
action->Harmful Mutation.description:
Trigger A creature begins its turn in the fog

Effect The fog surges with energy, dealing @Damage[(6d10+27)[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the fog as it harmfully mutates their bodies. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage. It resists mutation.

Failure The creature takes full damage. Its flesh becomes coated in foul-smelling blisters for 1 hour. For as long as it has this mutation, it is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and can't reduce the value of its sickened condition.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. Its limbs become painfully twisted for [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}. For as long as it has this mutation, it is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce the value of its sickened condition.

action->Drifter.name: Drifter
action->Drifter.description: The patrol dirigible can only be steered using its motorized propulsion, otherwise relying on favorable wind currents to carry it in the right direction. If the pilot fails to maintain control of the dirigible using its wind propulsion, the dirigible drifts whichever way the wind carries it, moving up to four times its Speed each round as determined by the GM.

action->Hangar Bay.name: Hangar Bay
action->Hangar Bay.description: The patrol dirigible provides a place for up to two Huge or smaller vehicles to be docked.

Phantom Communication.name: Phantom Communication
Phantom Communication.descriptionHazard: Angry spirits utter haunting threats and condemnations through a nearby comm unit.
Phantom Communication.disable: @Check[religion|dc:15] (trained) to banish the spirits, or @Check[performance|dc:18] to drown out the spirits' voices, or @Check[computers|dc:16] (trained) to disperse the ghostly signal

action->Threatening Message.name: Threatening Message
action->Threatening Message.description:
Trigger A creature with a comm unit enters the haunt's area

Effect The haunt utters threats through the triggering comm unit, dealing @Damage[(1d6+4)[mental]] damage to creatures within 20 feet of the comm unit (@Check[will|dc:19|basic] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Psychotropic Spores.name: Psychotropic Spores
Psychotropic Spores.descriptionHazard: A colorful fungus releases psychotropic spores when a creature comes near.
Psychotropic Spores.disable: @Check[nature|dc:20] (trained) to force the fungus into a dormant state, or @Check[survival|dc:22] (trained) to safely remove the fungus
Psychotropic Spores.reset: Dormant fungus reactivates in 1 hour; destroyed fungus regrows over the course of 2 weeks.

action->Release Spores.name: Release Spores
action->Release Spores.description:
Trigger A creatures touches or damages the fungus

Effect The fungus releases psychotropic spores in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. All creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 10 minutes (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

Quantum Clone.name: Quantum Clone
Quantum Clone.descriptionHazard: Quantum particles form an exact copy of a creature that can mimic its actions, speech, and thoughts with eerie perfection.
Quantum Clone.disable: @Check[intimidation|dc:42] (master) to frighten the clone away, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:42] (master) to reach an accord with the clone, or @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master) or Nature (master) to disperse the quantum particles; three total successes are required to disable the trap
Quantum Clone.routine: (3 actions) The quantum clone observes the triggering creature and mimics the creature's behavior, taking hostile actions as soon as it takes damage. For the first 2 rounds, the quantum clone takes actions in the exact order the triggering creature did, but in the following rounds, it acts tactically, using actions and reactions it observed the creature using in any order.

action->Materialize.name: Materialize
action->Materialize.description:
Trigger A creature touches the quantum particles

Effect The quantum particles materialize a perfect copy of the triggering creature. The quantum clone is visually identical to the creature and mimics the creature's actions and speech until it has time to observe and learn the creature's patterns well enough to act entirely on its own, a process that takes 1 minute. The quantum clone materializes with no weapons or equipment but can use unarmed Strikes if the creature has them. The quantum clone rolls initiative.

action->Mimic.name: Mimic
action->Mimic.description: 1 to 3 The quantum clone mimics an action it's observed the triggering creature take, including class abilities, movements, spells, and speech. It attacks on its initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature.

Reactor Meltdown.name: Reactor Meltdown
Reactor Meltdown.disable: @Check[computers|dc:45] (master) or Crafting (master) to initiate shutdown procedures, or @Check[thievery|dc:47] (master) to vent the reactor; three total successes are required to disable the trap
Reactor Meltdown.routine: (1 action) As the reactor overheats, the trap deals @Damage[(4d10+20)[fire]] damage to creatures within 60 feet (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). All creatures in the area are exposed to incredible radiation. Each time the trap uses this routine, the area increases by 10 feet. When the routine's radius equals 100 feet, resolve the routine. Then, the reactor immediately explodes, using Nuclear Explosion.

action->Radiation Leak.name: Radiation Leak
action->Radiation Leak.description:
Trigger A creature views the reactor's sensors or console

Effect Creatures within 60 feet of the reactor are exposed to incredible radiation (@Check[fortitude|dc:32]; page 91). The trap rolls initiative.

action->Nuclear Explosion.name: Nuclear Explosion
action->Nuclear Explosion.description:
Trigger The trap completed its routine with a radius of 100 feet

Effect The reactor explodes, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[fire]] damage in a 500 foot radius, bypassing the hardness of any items in the blast zone (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic] save). Everything in the area is exposed to incredible radiation. The area of the nuclear explosion becomes irradiated, leaking severe radiation for 50 years.

Reality Geyser.name: Reality Geyser
Reality Geyser.descriptionHazard: A tear in reality emits a chaotic churn of energy into the air like a geyser, raining destruction down on an area.
Reality Geyser.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:27] (expert) to diffuse the magical energy, or @Check[nature|dc:25] (expert) to seal the tear, or @Check[survival|dc:30] (trained) to coax the earth back together
Reality Geyser.routine: (2 actions) A chaotic churn of energy blasts out of the tear, dealing @Damage[(2d10+5)[acid]] damage to all creatures in a 30-foot-tall cylinder centered on the tear (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). Creatures damaged by this energy are additionally pushed 10 feet into the air (20 feet on a critical failure). This dispersed energy then rains down, dealing @Damage[1d10[fire]] damage to all creatures within 60 feet of the tear (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save).

action->Tear Reality.name: Tear Reality
action->Tear Reality.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the dormant tear

Effect A tear opens in reality, gouging a 5-foot radius hole in the earth. The trap rolls initiative.

Repulsing Force Field.name: Repulsing Force Field
Repulsing Force Field.descriptionHazard: A translucent force field appears to block a creature's path, shunting it and any other creature that attempts to pass it away.
Repulsing Force Field.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (expert) to disable the force field, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th rank; counteract DC 29) to counteract the force field
Repulsing Force Field.reset: The force field deactivates and the trap resets after 1 minute.

action->Forbid Entry.name: Forbid Entry
action->Forbid Entry.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to pass the designated area

Effect The force field appears and shunts the creature away, making a Strike against the triggering creature.

strike-melee->Force Field.name: Force Field
strike-melee->Force Field.description: plus the target is knocked back 10 feet (20 feet on a critical hit). The force field takes a –2 circumstance penalty to hit if the triggering creature Stepped or was moved by a forced movement effect.

Sentry Turret.name: Sentry Turret
Sentry Turret.disable: @Check[computers|dc:20] (trained) to reprogram the turret, or @Check[crafting|dc:19] (trained) to cut power to the turret, or @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to disable the turret
Sentry Turret.routine: (3 actions) The trap makes three oversized machine gun Strikes against a creature in range, or the trap makes an Auto-Fire attack followed by one Strike against a creature in range.

action->Open Fire.name: Open Fire
action->Open Fire.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the turret or attacks the turret

Effect The turret makes a ranged Strike against the triggering creature; the trap then rolls initiative.

action->Auto-Fire.name: Auto-Fire
action->Auto-Fire.description:
Oversized machine gun (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|traits:analog] save) (analog, @Template[type:cone|distance:45]), Damage @Damage[(2d8+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage]

You attempt to hit each creature in a cone with a range equal to half the weapon's range increment without making an attack roll. Any creature in the area takes weapon damage (Basic DC 25 reflex save). This damage is area damage. Creatures that critically fail this save are subject to effects that occur on a critical hit with this weapon, including the weapon's critical specialization effect. Auto-Fire has an expend equal to the number of targets in the area × 2.

action->Harness the Storm.name: Harness the Storm
action->Harness the Storm.description:
Requirements The skyboat is in a rainstorm

Effect The skyboat harnesses the storm's electrical energy through its magical sails, then expels this energy as a bolt of lightning that erupts from the front of the skyboat. The lightning deals @Damage[2d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). Harness the Storm stops working if the skyboat is broken.

Soul Upload.name: Soul Upload
Soul Upload.descriptionHazard: A computer is protected by a hybrid trap, which uploads the soul of all unauthorized users to an inert data module on the computer.
Soul Upload.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:36] (expert) to drain the computer's magical energy, or @Check[computers|dc:36] (expert) to falsify authorized credentials, or @Check[thievery|dc:40] (expert) to disable the trap, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank; counteract DC 34) to counteract the trap

action->Upload Soul.name: Upload Soul
action->Upload Soul.description:
Trigger An unauthorized creature grasps the computer directly or with a tool

Effect The trap attempts to upload the triggering creature's soul into the computer. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+15)[spirit]] damage.

Failure The creature's soul is temporarily pulled from their body. It takes @Damage[(6d10+30)[spirit]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Critical Failure The creature's soul is pulled from its body and uploaded to a data module on the computer. Its body remains a soulless vessel, which slowly dies over the course of 1 week unless its soul is returned. Destroying the computer destroys its soul.

Temporal Rift.name: Temporal Rift
Temporal Rift.descriptionHazard: A rift in time rapidly ages and slows anyone who draws near.
Temporal Rift.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:36] (master) or Occultism (master) to magically mend time, @Check[thievery|dc:40] (master) to repair the time rift, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th rank; counteract DC 31) to counteract the rift

action->Time Shudder.name: Time Shudder
action->Time Shudder.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the rift

Effect The triggering creature takes 6d10+20 damage as its body rapidly ages. It must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, becomes clumsy 2 and enfeebled 2, and becomes slowed for 1 minute.

action->Submersible.name: Submersible
action->Submersible.description: The torpedo minisub can travel beneath the surface of the water, carrying an air reservoir suitable to sustain 2 Medium creatures for up to 24 hours. The torpedo minisub can safely reach depths of up to 1 mile. If broken, the torpedo minisub loses air from its reservoir, reducing the stored air by 10 minutes per round. A broken torpedo minisub has its maximum depth reduced by half (and rises to that depth when broken, if necessary).

Tranquilizer Darts Trap.name: Tranquilizer Darts Trap
Tranquilizer Darts Trap.descriptionHazard: Weight-sensitive pressure plates in the floor trigger a hole at the hallway's end to fire tranquilizer darts at creatures in the hall.
Tranquilizer Darts Trap.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:18] (trained) or Thievery (trained) to disable the pressure plates

action->Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
action->Dart Volley.description:
Trigger A creature steps on a pressure plate

Effect The trap makes a tranquilizer dart Strike against up to three creatures in the hall. Ranged tranquilizer dart +14, Damage 1d6 piercing and 1d6 poison plus tranquilizer; no multiple attack penalty Tranquilizer (incapacitation, poison)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 clumsy 1 and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and asleep for 1 minute (1 minute)

Trash Compactor.name: Trash Compactor
Trash Compactor.descriptionHazard: When activated, the automated trash compactor slowly crushes everything inside it.
Trash Compactor.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:26] (expert) to jam the crushing mechanism, or @Check[thievery|dc:24] (expert) to deactivate the trap; @Check[athletics|dc:28] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the door (this doesn't disable the trap)
Trash Compactor.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Trash Compactor.routine: (1 action) Two of the room's walls move 5 feet toward the center of the room, automatically pushing any creatures in those spaces 5 feet closer to the room's center and dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the room (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save). Creatures that die from this damage are crushed to a fine paste.

action->Commence Crushing.name: Commence Crushing
action->Commence Crushing.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures end their turn in the room

Effect The doors slam shut, sealing the room. The trap then rolls initiative.

Traumatic Moment.name: Traumatic Moment
Traumatic Moment.descriptionHazard: A psychic imprint of a horrific event replays in vivid detail.
Traumatic Moment.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) or Religion (expert) to cleanse the area

action->Jump Scare.name: Jump Scare
action->Jump Scare.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the haunted area

Effect The haunt replays the traumatic moment that created it, vividly assaulting the creature's senses as though the creature was experiencing the event. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[(2d8+5)[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d8+10)[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(8d8+20)[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

action->Cruising Drop.name: Cruising Drop
action->Cruising Drop.description: The only way to use the wind propulsion of a turboglider is to jump off a steep incline or if you're already in the air. An uncontrolled turboglider using wind propulsion falls 60 feet each round until the pilot successfully Takes Control. A turboglider must be controlled to switch propulsion. If the glider hits the ground before the pilot successfully Takes Control, the pilot and the glider each take falling damage.

action->Middle Seat.name: Middle Seat
action->Middle Seat.description: A Small creature can fit in the backseat of an urban cruiser that already has 3 passengers.

Venting Airlock.name: Venting Airlock
Venting Airlock.descriptionHazard: A malfunctioning airlock opens unexpectedly while creatures are inside.
Venting Airlock.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:17] (trained) to repair the airlock, or @Check[thievery|dc:17] (trained) to jam the airlock closed

action->Vent.name: Vent
action->Vent.description:
Trigger One or more creatures enters the airlock compartment

Effect The outer airlock door opens, venting breathable air out into the vacuum or harmful atmosphere beyond. The creature begins suffocating and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is sucked 10 feet out of the airlock and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Failure The target is sucked 10 feet out of the airlock and takes @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Vision of Manifold Realities.name: Vision of Manifold Realities
Vision of Manifold Realities.descriptionHazard: Wisps of reality-warping magic that flit through the room are drawn to intelligent creatures, filling their minds with visions of countless alternate realities.
Vision of Manifold Realities.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:26] (expert) to banish the visions, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) to exert your will over the visions, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 24) to counteract the visions

action->Glimpse Manifold Realities.name: Glimpse Manifold Realities
action->Glimpse Manifold Realities.description:
Trigger An intelligent creature enters the area

Effect The trap deals @Damage[(4d8+18)[mental]] damage to all intelligent creatures who can perceive the visions (@Check[will|dc:26|basic] save). Creatures who critically fail additionally lose themself in the visions, becoming @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wakeskimmer.name: Wakeskimmer
Wakeskimmer.speed: fly 60 feet (motorized; space only) or swim 40 feet (motorized)

action->Sea-to-Sky Transference.name: Sea-to-Sky Transference
action->Sea-to-Sky Transference.description: The pilot engages transference mode, causing the wakeskimmer to launch itself from a body of water (or other fluid) up into orbit or to plummet from space into the sea, at a Speed of 1,500 feet per round.

action->Space Vehicle.name: Space Vehicle
action->Space Vehicle.description: This vehicle protects its users from the dangers of space, including the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.FLODmOj4yK7eJn0a]{Basic Environmental Protection} and a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.0kD0MZgiK0SYS6e6]{Commercial Filtered Rebreather}.
